text: The retinoblastoma gene product negatively regulates transcriptional activation mediated by the human cytomegalovirus <extra_id_0> IE2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .
The <extra_id_0> IE2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene product of human cytomegalovirus ( HCMV ) is one of a few viral regulatory proteins expressed immediately upon infection of the host cell .

text: It is a potent transcriptional activator of many viral and cellular promoters .

We found that the retinoblastoma susceptibility gene product ( <extra_id_0> Rb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) dramatically suppressed this <extra_id_0> IE2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivation of various promoters .

text: Our results suggest that <extra_id_0> Rb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may regulate the life cycle of HCMV , which is endemic in the human population .
Furthermore , these data may provide new insights into the slow rate of HCMV DNA replication in cells and the possible involvement of HCMV in tumorigenesis .
